required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Safety, Tolerability, Pharmacokinetics and Efficacy Study of GB261 in B-Cell NHL and CLL.
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase Ⅰ/Ⅱ, Open-Label, Multicenter Study Evaluating the Safety, Tolerability, Pharmacokinetics and Efficacy of GB261 in Patients With Relapsed or Refractory B-Cell Non-Hodgkin Lymphoma and Chronic Lymphocytic Leukemia

brief_summary.textblock: This is a Phase 1/2 study of GB261 in participants with relapsed or refractory B-cell NHL and CLL. The study will consist of a dose-escalation stage(Phase 1), an expansion stage(Phase 2a) and Phase 2b stage where participants will be enrolled into indication-specific cohorts.

primary_outcome.description: To determine the maximum Tolerated Dose (MTD) of GB261
To determine the frequency and nature of Dose Limiting Toxicity (DLT) of GB261

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of participants with adverse events
primary_outcome.time_frame: From first dosing until 90 days after the last treatment
primary_outcome.description: To determine the percentage of participants with adverse events

primary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 3 years
primary_outcome.description: To determine the Objective Response Rate (ORR) of GB261

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At predefined intervals up to 106 days
secondary_outcome.description: To determine the Cmax of GB261

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At predefined intervals up to 106 days
secondary_outcome.description: To determine the Tmax of GB261

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At predefined intervals up to 106 days
secondary_outcome.description: To determine the Area Under the Curve (AUC) of GB261

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At predefined intervals up to 106 days
secondary_outcome.description: To determine the t1/2 of GB261

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At predefined intervals up to 106 days
secondary_outcome.description: To determine the Clearance (CL) of GB261

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At predefined intervals up to 106 days
secondary_outcome.description: To determine the Vz of GB261

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At predefined intervals up to 3 years
secondary_outcome.description: To determine Anti-Drug Antibody (ADA) of GB261

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 3 years
secondary_outcome.description: To determine the progression free survival (PFS)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 3 years
secondary_outcome.description: To determine the Duration of Objective Response (DOR)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 3 years
secondary_outcome.description: To determine the Duration of Objective Complete Response (DOCR)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 3 years

arm_group.description: Participants will receive GB261 via intravenous (IV) infusion as a single agent on Day 1, Day 8 and Day 15 of Cycle 1 and 2 followed by Day 1 of each cycle（21 days per cycle） afterwards until disease progression or other situations specified in the protocol, whichever comes earlier.

intervention.description: Drug:GB261 IV, participants with B-cell NHL or CLL will receive GB261 via IV infusion weekly for the first two cycles(1cycle=21days), followed by Q3W from C3 and afterwards in given doses until progression disease or other situations specified in the protocol, whichever comes earlier.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group (ECOG) performance status of 0 or 1
2. CD20+ B-cell Non-Hodgkin Lymphoma or CLL who have relapsed or failed to respond to at least one prior treatment regimen and for whom there is no available therapy expected to improve survival
3. Adequate hepatic, h
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Key inclusion criteria：
2. Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group (ECOG) performance status of 0 or 1
3. CD20+ B-cell Non-Hodgkin Lymphoma or CLL who have relapsed or failed to respond to at least one prior treatment regimen and for whom there is no available therapy expected to improve survival
4. Adequate hepatic, hematologic, and renal function
5. Key exclusion criteria:
6. Burkitt lymphoma, lymphoplasmacytic lymphoma or B lymphoblastic leukemia
7. Prior treatment with systemic anti-lymphoma therapy within 4 weeks or five half-lives of the drug (which is shorter) prior to the first GB261 infusion
8. History of auto-SCT or CAR-T therapy in the past 180 days and/or with any of protocol specified conditions
9. Prior allo-SCT or allogeneic CAR-T
10. Prior solid organ transplantation
11. Autoimmune disease with the exceptions specified in the protocol
12. History of central nervous system(CNS) lymphoma or other CNS disease
13. Significant cardiovascular or pulmonary disease
14. Hepatitis B or C or human immunodeficiency virus (HIV)
15. Pregnant or lactating or intending to become pregnant during the study

overall_official.affiliation: Peninsula & South Eastern Haematology & Oncology Group
